subject: Travel
title: Why It Was Called the Silk Road
description: A 60-second lesson on Why It Was Called the Silk Road.

hook.text: The name 'Silk Road' sounds ancient. It was actually coined by a German geographer in 1877.

buildup.text: Ferdinand von Richthofen needed a catchy term for his maps of Asian trade routes.

discovery.text: Silk was China's most prized export. Romans paid its weight in gold for the fabric.

twist.text: China guarded the secret of silk production for centuries. Smuggling silkworms meant death.

climax.text: Monks eventually smuggled silkworm eggs out in hollow bamboo canes, breaking the monopoly.

punchline.text: The road's name is modern, but the silk was priceless.

quiz.question: When was the term 'Silk Road' first used?
